comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/27331537@N06]  The photograph of the locomotive without its tender looks like a builders photograph, or perhaps an 'official' photograph taken upon completion as No 60 was the class leader.

The NSW (O) 60-class entered service between October 1874 and January 1875. Built in England by Stephenson's and erected locally by Mort and Company, Sydney.  No 60 entered service in December 1874 and was withdrawn in 1889 having travelled 619,205 miles in the service of the state.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncowper] Thanks for this useful information on the (O) 60-Class; I'll pass it along.
